pull.title: Add OSX keystroke to clear RPCConsole
pull.body: Currently only Ctrl-L is mentioned in help, but, CMD-L works on OSX and isn't mentioned.

events.body: Improved the code to use an ifdef for OSX instead.
@laanwj When I find some time I will add to platformstyle.cpp and update the translation files as it isn't difficult, just time consuming.
@paveljanik thats what happens when you edit via mobile and online on GitHub

events.message:
Add OSX keystroke to clear RPCConsole

Currently only Ctrl-L is mentioned in help, but, CMD-L works on OSX and isn't mentioned.

events.body:
@laanwj @jonasschnelli @paveljanik 

All squashed and good to go ;)
In the help of e.g. Terminal and Safari, I see Command ()-L notation.
I realised that this work was not done on a Bitcoin fork and in fact a fork of Dash, that had been subsequently deleted, the new PR for this is #10362

comments.body: I'm not usually a person to say this but: let's make this message platform dependent instead of enumerating the platforms here.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -731,8 +731,12 @@ void RPCConsole::clear(bool clearHistory) ); message(CMD_REPLY, (tr("Welcome to the %1 RPC console.").arg(tr(PACKAGE_NAME)) + "
" + - tr("Use up and down arrows to navigate history, and Ctrl-L to clear screen.") + "
" + - tr("Type help for an overview of available commands.")) + +#ifdef Q_OS_MAC + tr("Use up and down arrows to navigate history, and cmd-L to clear screen.") + "
" + +#else + tr("Use up and down arrows to navigate history, and Ctrl-L to clear screen.") + "
" + +#endif + tr("Type help for an overview of available commands.")) +
comments.body:
Possible suggestion: ```c++ #ifdef Q_OS_MAC QString clearKeyStr = "cmd-L"; #else QString clearKeyStr = "Ctrl-L"; #endif ... tr("Use up and down arrows to navigate history, and %1 to clear screen.").arg(clearKeyStr) + "
" + ``` After all: - The key is not to be translated - Also gets rid of the HTML formatting in the translation string in one go

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -731,8 +731,12 @@ void RPCConsole::clear(bool clearHistory) ); message(CMD_REPLY, (tr("Welcome to the %1 RPC console.").arg(tr(PACKAGE_NAME)) + "
" + - tr("Use up and down arrows to navigate history, and Ctrl-L to clear screen.") + "
" + - tr("Type help for an overview of available commands.")) + +#ifdef Q_OS_MAC + tr("Use up and down arrows to navigate history, and cmd-L to clear screen.") + "
" + +#else + tr("Use up and down arrows to navigate history, and Ctrl-L to clear screen.") + "
" + +#endif + tr("Type help for an overview of available commands.")) +
comments.body:
If we are already bikeshedding:
Alternative suggestion would be adding `QString generalFunctionKey()` to platformstyles.cpp.
Then use something like `tr("Use up and down arrows to navigate history, and %1-L to clear screen.").arg(platformStyle->generalFunctionKey())`

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -731,8 +731,12 @@ void RPCConsole::clear(bool clearHistory) ); message(CMD_REPLY, (tr("Welcome to the %1 RPC console.").arg(tr(PACKAGE_NAME)) + "
" + - tr("Use up and down arrows to navigate history, and Ctrl-L to clear screen.") + "
" + - tr("Type help for an overview of available commands.")) + +#ifdef Q_OS_MAC + tr("Use up and down arrows to navigate history, and cmd-L to clear screen.") + "

" + +#endif + tr("Type help for an overview of available commands.")) +
comments.body: I guess you can also do `arg(""+platformStyle->generalFunctionKey()+"")` to avoid html in translatable strings.

" + - tr("Use up and down arrows to navigate history, and Ctrl-L to clear screen.") + "
" + - tr("Type help for an overview of available commands.")) + +#ifdef Q_OS_MAC + tr("Use up and down arrows to navigate history, and cmd-L to clear screen.") + "
" + +#else + tr("Use up and down arrows to navigate history, and Ctrl-L to clear screen.") + "
" + +#endif + tr("Type help for an overview of available commands.")) +
comments.body: Yes, adding it to platformStyle would be another step further, I didn't want to suggest that here to not make life too difficult for @spencerlievens while also not making life harder for translators by adding another message that is almost-the-same.

comments.body: Yeah adding to platform style is certainly the more "correct" path, but induces a lot of work.
There is a TAB on this otherwise empty line.
Can you please move this HTML down to `arg(clsKey)`? E.g. ```C++ arg(""+clsKey+) ``` or something and remove it from here?
